I. Cover letter containing a list of contents and the total budget of the study in Greece (summary)
II. General Part: The documentation to be included in the General Part of the filing file to the EOF is set out in Annex XV, Chapter II of Regulation (EU) 2017/745.
III. Special Part: In addition to the supporting documents of the General Part, the file to the EOF will include the following Special supporting documents:
Completed the application form in Greek (available on the EOF website), in searchable pdf format, with signature, signatory details and date
General Summary of the clinical investigation plan (SYNOPSIS) in the Greek language (Relative to Section 3.1.5 of Reg. 2017/745, Par. XV, Chapter II)
Patient information and consent form (s), in Greek (& original in English if available).
If the applicant is not the sponsor, a letter of authorization to the applicant to act on behalf of the sponsor.
Model of the label in the Greek language in which there will be, among other information, the labeling "exclusively for clinical trials".

Responsible statement from the sponsor stating whether the product contains as an integral part of the substance or derivative of human blood (in addition to Point 2.6 of Reg. 2017/745, Par. XV, Chapter II).
Proof of payment of a fee in favor of EOF

6.3. Description and justification of statistical data, analytical method and procedures.
1.1. Name of manufacturer / authorized representative, address, telephone, contact details for communication
1.2. If it is the first request for investigation / evaluation or resolution
1.3. If there is a recurrence related to the same device, the reference number (s) and previous data from the latest investigations
1.4. Other Member States participating in the clinical investigation / performance evaluation as part of the multinational / multicentre study
2.1. Device trade name; 2.2. Generic device name; 2.3. Device model name; 2.4. Model number, if any.

3.1. Classification
3.2. A complete description of the device
3.5. Summary of experiences with any similar device.
3.7. Summary and analysis of preclinical tests and experimental data
4.1. Names, qualifications, professional position, addresses of clinical investigators, coordinating investigator, if any, from multi-center clinical investigation
4.4. Copy of the Ethics Committee's opinion
4.5. Copy of the patient's informed consent
4.6. Copy of the document on how to compensate the patient in case of deterioration of his health following the clinical investigation
4.7. The summary of the reference scientific literature that was the basis of the study, with analysis and bibliography, if applicable.
6.1. Description of the final results to demonstrate the performance and safety of the use of the device
6.2. Description of procedures and details of incident recording and reporting,
6.3. Description and justification of statistical data, analytical method and procedures.

other specific information (eg qualifications of the principal investigator and researchers).

I. Cover letter which will include a list of contents
II. General Part: The documentation to be included in the General Part of the filing file to the EOF is set out in Annex XV, Chapter II of Regulation (EU) 2017/745.
III. Special Part: In addition to the supporting documents of the General Part, the file to the EOF will include the following Special supporting documents:
Completed the application form in Greek (available on the EOF website), in searchable pdf format, with signature, signatory details and date
General Summary of the clinical investigation plan (SYNOPSIS) in the Greek language (Relative to Section 3.1.5 of Reg. 2017/745, Par. XV, Chapter II)
Patient information and consent form (s), in Greek (& original in English if available).
If the applicant is not the sponsor, a letter of authorization to the applicant to act on behalf of the sponsor.
Model of the label in the Greek language in which there will be, among other information, the labeling "exclusively for clinical trials".

Responsible statement from the sponsor stating whether the product contains as an integral part of the substance or derivative of human blood (in addition to Point 2.6 of Reg. 2017/745, Par. XV, Chapter II).
Proof of payment of a fee in favor of EOF
